inventory.commentary: 10Dec08 - revised features and definition for S2. ahouston

sense.name: a subcategory in a classification scheme
sense.commentary: SORT[+system][+classification][+subcategory][+characterized] Use this sense if there is a quantifier or determiner preceding 'sort of' Use this sense when the word immediately following 'sort of' is a noun, not a modifier, verb or adverb (Sense 2)
sense.examples: This is the wrong sort of nail to attach shingles with. How many sorts of chili peppers are there? He wants to go to China for all sorts of reasons. A jumper is a sort of dress.

sense.name: an approximate attribute or quality of something
sense.commentary: SORT[+quality][+attribute][+approximate] Use this sense when the word immediately following 'sort of' is a modifier.adverb,verb not a noun. (Sense 1) Use this sense in constructions of the form 'NP of sorts', which implies an approximate quality. Note: if 'sort' is preceded by a quantifier, it is Sense 1 (e.g., she wore some sort of a magenta dress is a TYPE of dress,)
sense.examples: She wore a sort of magenta dress. This dessert is sort of creamy and moist. He is sort of interested in taking flying lessons. It is sort of time for Bob to start thinking about finishing his degree. ('time' is adverbial here) It's a compromise of sorts. They were sort of talking about moving to Vermont.

sense.name: a person identified by a specific nature or characteristic
sense.commentary: SORT[+entity][+person][+characterized][+specifically] Note: a narrow usage of Sense 1 - but always refers to a person or group or people
sense.examples: Frank is a genuinely friendly sort. The people who run the government offices are a lazy sort.

sense.name: an operation that groups items according to specific criteria
sense.examples: This algorithm describes a simple bubble sort. My computer can perform these sorts in a matter of seconds. The machine's sort of coffee beans by size is still not quite accurate enough.

sense.name: a character or component of a typesetting font
sense.examples: These sorts are Helvetica not Ariel.
